head.title: Islamic Party Closer to Coalition in Turkey

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: Islamic Party Closer to Coalition in Turkey

block.p: Turkey's leading Islamic party came closer to taking a share of power today after talks on forming a cabinet with a conservative party.

"An agreement will be reached to form a coalition Government," Necmettin Erbakan, the leader of the Islamic group, the Welfare Party, said at a joint news conference with the head of the Motherland Party, Mesut Yilmaz.
Turkey's leading Islamic party came closer to taking a share of power today after talks on forming a cabinet with a conservative party.

"An agreement will be reached to form a coalition Government," Necmettin Erbakan, the leader of the Islamic group, the Welfare Party, said at a joint news conference with the head of the Motherland Party, Mesut Yilmaz.
We made considerable progress towards an agreement," Mr. Yilmaz said. "We have agreed to meet again on Saturday."

The Welfare Party finished first by a narrow margin in elections last December, but has so far failed to find any coalition partner among Turkey's secular parties, including the True Path Party of the caretaker Prime Minister, Tansu Ciller.
The current talks are widely seen as the last chance at forming a Government before President Suleyman Demirel appoints a compromise Government or calls early elections to break the impasse.
The Welfare Party won 158 seats in the 550-member Parliament in the best showing at general polls by Islamic militants in Turkey's 73 years as a secular republic.
